skill.name: webapp-testing
skill.description: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright. Supports verifying frontend functionality, debugging UI behavior, capturing browser screenshots, and viewing browser logs.

security_audit.summary: Legitimate Playwright-based testing toolkit. All network connections are to localhost only. Filesystem writes target user-controlled directories (/tmp, /mnt/user-data/outputs). Subprocess usage in with_server.py is appropriate for local dev server management. Static findings are false positives triggered by documentation code examples, license text, and JSON field names.

low_findings.title: Shell execution for local dev servers
low_findings.description: with_server.py uses subprocess with shell=True to run user-provided server commands. This is necessary for the tool's purpose but allows arbitrary command execution. However, this is a local testing tool where the user provides their own commands.

content.user_title: Test local web apps with Playwright automation
content.value_statement: Testing local web applications requires setting up servers, navigating pages, and verifying behavior. This toolkit provides Playwright automation scripts for browser testing, screenshot capture, and server lifecycle management so you can focus on writing tests.
actual_capabilities: Launch headless Chromium browsers for automated testing
Capture full-page screenshots of web application states
Discover and interact with DOM elements (buttons, links, inputs)
Capture browser console logs during test execution
Manage local dev server lifecycle (start, wait, stop)
Test static HTML files and dynamic web applications
limitations: Requires Playwright and browser binaries installed
Designed for local development servers only
Does not test remote or production URLs
Scripts must be run directly, not imported as modules

use_cases.title: Test React, Vue, or Svelte apps
use_cases.description: Automate user flows in your frontend framework app and capture screenshots at each step for visual regression testing.

use_cases.title: Verify UI functionality
use_cases.description: Create automated tests that click through pages, fill forms, and verify expected console errors or warnings.

use_cases.title: Test multi-service applications
use_cases.description: Start backend and frontend servers together, wait for both to be ready, then run integration tests.

prompt_templates.title: Basic screenshot
prompt_templates.prompt: Take a screenshot of http://localhost:5173 and save it to /tmp/homepage.png

prompt_templates.title: Form testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Fill out the contact form at http://localhost:3000/contact with test data and submit it

prompt_templates.title: Console error check
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to http://localhost:5173, capture all console messages, and save them to /tmp/logs.txt

prompt_templates.title: Multi-server test
prompt_templates.prompt: Start a backend server on port 3000 and frontend on port 5173, then test the login flow

output: Console captured 8 messages: 1 error, 2 warnings, 5 info

best_practices: Always run scripts with --help first to understand available options
Use sync_playwright() for simpler synchronous automation scripts
Wait for networkidle before inspecting DOM on dynamic applications
anti_patterns: Do not inspect DOM before the page has fully loaded
Do not forget to close the browser after automation completes
Do not use production URLs - this tool is for local testing only

faq.question: What browsers does this skill support?
faq.answer: Playwright supports Chromium, Firefox, and WebKit. The examples use Chromium in headless mode.

faq.question: Can I test production websites?
faq.answer: No, this skill is designed for local development servers. Use localhost URLs only.

faq.question: How do I run multiple servers together?
faq.answer: Pass multiple --server and --port pairs to with_server.py. The script waits for all servers before running your test.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. All automation runs locally on your machine. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why do I see context window full warnings?
faq.answer: The helper scripts are large. Run them directly with --help instead of reading the source code.

faq.question: How is this different from Selenium?
faq.answer: Playwright is more modern, faster, and has better support for modern web apps. It handles single-page apps and dynamic content better.
